result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael J Rose was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Concurrent with: Concurrent with Probation in La Crosse Co case 14CM1586, with same conditions also concurrent
.

miscConds.notes:
Def to undergo Alcohol and Drug Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommendations.
.

Upon successful completion of all terms and conditions of probation, the record will be expunged under 973.015.
.

Undergo any other assessments or evaluations deemed appropriate by the PO and follow-through with any treatment recommended

Pay Crime Lab and Drug Assessment fee (see 'other' above for amount)

Cash bond on file is applied to financial obligations owed - PAID IN FULL - DOC DOES NOT COLLECT

Pay DOC Supervision fees

Credit for 6 days if probation is ever revoked

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of resititution victims and/or govermental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt

supervisions.notes:
The balance of the sentence can be served on Electronic Monitoring through Justice Support Services at defendant's mother's residence

Unpaid Court financial obligations are converted to a Civil Judgment - the defendant is to pay $10 per month - first payment is due 6-1-17
.

From: Def 
SLH: CC: parties

State by Vasupuram / Def w/ Atty Joseph Geraldson
Vasupuram:  def has picked up new charges - concerns about competency...wondering if CRT would be willing to grant State's req for competency exam
Geraldson:  I don't think he needs it - he can participate in his own defense - understands charges against him - he has picked up a new case
Vasupuram gives CRT details of new case - reads Complaint to CRT
CRT comments...Mr. Rose, are you willing to cooperate with an outpatient evaluation in the community
Def:  no
CRT:  you understand if you refuse to cooperate w/ an outpatient evaluation that you leave me no choice but to order inpatient comp eval to proceed
Def:  no
CRT:  those are my choices, you can do it outpatient in community or in custody inpatient
Def:  outpatient
CRT:  Ok - so you understand that if you don't cooperate w/ evaluation, the CRT will take you into custody
Def:  I do not
CRT:  it is in interest of Judical economy that all cases of def be dealt together so the trial currently scheduled will be postponed.  Def will be evaluated & CRT will ask that new cases be consolidated - it would make more sense to do IA on new case now & consolidate all 3 cases here for purposes of Comp Evaluation.
Def:  no objection
Motion for Consolidation w/ Cases 14CM1586, 15CM362 & 15CM384 - Order consolidating cases in Br 1 signed by RAG
CRT finds Prob Cause on all cases & that at this time CRT has reason to believe Def is not capable of assisting his atty in understanding rational behind his rights at this point & will req he be evaluated on out-patient basis for his competency - examination to be completed & report filed w/in 30 days of today's date - State will contact the WI St Forensic Lab to accomplish this - Def has agreed to participate in that competency eval & if he does not cooperate, it will be done in custody.
COMPETENCY HRG:  5-11-15 @ 3:30 w/ RAG
CRT:  Add to bond conditions:  No Firearms during pendency of this case - def is able to go to driving class in violation of his curfew - it is @ WTC on Mondays & Wed from 7 pm to 9:30 pm.  Def can drive himself there allowing 20 min. each way for travel.
Joseph Geraldson
